translated: therefore, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva wishes to be the foremost of all sentient beings,🔽he should train in just this—

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid kyis rnam par spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par spyod pa 'di nyid kyis rnam par spyod par bya'o //
translated: the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das te /
translated: a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices this perfection of wisdom goes beyond the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug go /
translated: and enters into the certainty of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having entered into the certainty of bodhisattvas,🔽he will complete the buddhadharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having completed the buddhadharmas,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will attain the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su thob nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su thob nas /
translated: Having attained the knowledge of a knower of all aspects,

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro ////
translated: they will become a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened one, a perfectly enlightened one, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya lnga gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya lnga gcig pa /
translated: PART TWO

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams ma tog manda ra ba mang po thogs te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams ma tog manda ra ba mang po thogs te /
translated: Then, from within that assembly, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three took up many flower baskets of coral tree flowers🔽and scattered them over the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la gtor to; ;mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gtor to; ;mngon par gtor to //
translated: scattered them well,

original: rab tu gtor to //
analyzed: rab tu gtor to //
translated: and scattered them everywhere.

original: dge slong brgya drug cu tsam yang stan las langs nas chos gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
analyzed: dge slong brgya drug cu tsam yang stan las langs nas chos gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
translated: About one hundred and sixty monks also rose from their seats, draped their upper robes over one shoulder,

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs @422a *//
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs @422a *//
translated: and placed their right knees on the ground.

original: nas; bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud nas /
analyzed: nas; bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud nas /
translated: and bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined.

original: bcom ldan 'das la mig mi 'dzums par lta zhing phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mig mi 'dzums par lta zhing phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: They paid homage to the Blessed One by gazing upon him with unblinking eyes.

original: dge slong de dag gis thal mo sbyor te btud pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis thal mo sbyor te btud pa'i tshe /
translated: When those monks bowed with palms joined,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus snyim pa me tog manda ra bas gang bar gyur nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus snyim pa me tog manda ra bas gang bar gyur nas /
translated: through the power of the Buddha, their cupped hands became filled with mandārava flowers.

original: me tog manda ra ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gtor to //🔽mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: me tog manda ra ba de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gtor to // mngon par gtor to //
translated: They scattered those mandārava flowers over the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: rab tu gtor to //
analyzed: rab tu gtor to //
translated: They scattered them over him,🔽and they scattered them over him again.

original: de ltar 'thor zhing mngon par 'thor ba dang / rab tu 'thor ba'i tshe; tshig 'di skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar 'thor zhing mngon par 'thor ba dang / rab tu 'thor ba'i tshe; tshig 'di skad ces brjod de /
translated: As they scattered them, they said these words:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One!

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul ma lags pa'i rnam par spyod pa dam pas; bdag cag rnam par spyod par gyur cig ces smras pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag gis bsam pa thugs su chud de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul ma lags pa'i rnam par spyod pa dam pas; bdag cag rnam par spyod par gyur cig ces smras pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de dag gis bsam pa thugs su chud de /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, knowing the thoughts that were in the minds of those bhikṣus,

original: de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid kyis kyang de ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid kyis kyang de ste /
translated: at that time smiled. It is the nature of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas that

original: de ltar 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i tshe /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i tshe / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas 'di lta ste /
translated: when they smile,

original: 'od zer sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu rnam pa sna tshogs byung ste /
analyzed: 'od zer sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / le brgan dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu rnam pa sna tshogs byung ste /
translated: from the mouth of the Bhagavān various blue, yellow, red, white, crystal, and silver-colored rays of light issue forth.

original: de dag gis stong gsum gyi @422b stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas rgyas par bkang nas phyir 'dus te /
analyzed: de dag gis stong gsum gyi @422b stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas rgyas par bkang nas phyir 'dus te /
translated: They fill the world realm of a billion worlds with light, and then return and

original: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum du g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum du g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te /
translated: He circumambulated the Bhagavān three times to the right,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug tu nub bo //
translated: and then disappeared into the crown of the Bhagavān’s head.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo stan las langs nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo stan las langs nas /
translated: Then the venerable Nanda rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /🔽pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas /
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te / pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas /
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder,🔽and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
translated: With palms placed together he bowed to the Bhagavān

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and made this request:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
translated: since the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas do not smile without a cause or a reason,

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis 'dzum pa mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis 'dzum pa mdzad /
translated: what is the cause and what is the reason for your smile?”🔽The Bhagavān said to the venerable Nanda,

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Nanda, Nanda,

original: dga' bo / dge slong brgya drug cu po 'di dag bskal pa dpe skar ma lta bu la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / dge slong brgya drug cu po 'di dag bskal pa dpe skar ma lta bu la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: Ananda, these one hundred and sixty monks will attain supreme awakening in the eon called Star-like.

original: me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will appear in the world as the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones called Flower-rain.

original: dga' bo me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun mtshungs @423a *//
analyzed: dga' bo me tog sil ma zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi dge slong gi dge 'dun mtshungs @423a *//
translated: Ananda, the saṅgha of monks of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones called Flower-rain will be equal,

original: par 'gyur / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtshungs par 'gyur /🔽tshe'i tshad kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: par 'gyur / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtshungs par 'gyur / tshe'i tshad kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: and their buddha-fields will be equal.🔽Their lifespans will be equal,

original: lo stong du mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lo stong du mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: namely one thousand years.

original: de dag gang dang gang nas mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par byung nas rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de dang de dag tu me tog kha dog rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i me tog gi char mngon par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gang dang gang nas mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / mngon par byung nas rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de dang de dag tu me tog kha dog rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i me tog gi char mngon par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever they appear, having appeared, they go forth; having gone forth, they are fully ordained; having been fully ordained, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dga' bo / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par spyod pa'i dam pas rnam par spyod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par spyod pa'i dam pas rnam par spyod par 'dod pas /
translated: Therefore, Nanda, a bodhisattva great being who wants to practice the highest practice

original: shes  kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes  kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyad par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyad par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o //
translated: A bodhisattva great being who wants to practice the practice of the Tathāgata should practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo des 'di ltar bdag ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa'am /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo des 'di ltar bdag ni mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa'am /
translated: “I have died among humans and been reborn here,

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa ste /
translated: or I have died among the gods of Tushita and been reborn here.

original: mi'i nang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'am /
analyzed: mi'i nang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'am /
translated: I have heard this profound perfection of wisdom extensively among humans,

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris su @423b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris su @423b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rgya cher thos pa'o zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: or I have heard this profound perfection of wisdom extensively among the gods of Tushita.”

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par gzigs par bltas te /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par gzigs par bltas te /
translated: Ananda, the Tathagata sees and observes those bodhisattva mahasattvas who practice this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / thos nas 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan pa dang / thos nas 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang /
translated: and after listening, takes it up, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston cing rjes su 'doms pa'i gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa des /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston cing rjes su 'doms pa'i gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa des /
translated: and properly pays attention to it, and if a person belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle teaches this profound perfection of wisdom and instructs others in it,

original: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos par gyur /
analyzed: bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos par gyur /
translated: that person belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle should think, ‘I have heard this profound perfection of wisdom from the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha.

original: bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas par gyur te /
analyzed: bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas par gyur te /
translated: I have taken it up, borne it in mind, read it aloud, and mastered it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la 'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bskyed par gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la 'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bskyed par gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that they have also generated many roots of virtue toward those tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des bdag gis ni nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des bdag gis ni nyan thos rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed /
translated: Nanda, a son of noble family or daughter of noble family should know that they have not generated roots of virtue toward the śrāvakas,

original: nyan @424a *// thos rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //🔽dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / don dang / chos dang /
analyzed: nyan @424a *// thos rnams las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o // dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / don dang / chos dang /
translated: and have not heard this profound perfection of wisdom from the śrāvakas.🔽 Nanda, if a son of noble family or daughter of noble family upholds,🔽carries, reads, masters, and understands the meaning, Dharma,

original: yi ge dang mthun par khong du chud par byed na /
analyzed: yi ge dang mthun par khong du chud par byed na /
translated: and letters of this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des bdag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des bdag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur to zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Ananda, you should know that this son or daughter of good family has actually seen the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa thos na /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa thos na /
translated: Ananda, if any son or daughter of good family, having heard this teaching of the profound perfection of wisdom,

original: phyir mi ldog cing ngan du mi brjod la thos nas kyang mos pa thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog cing ngan du mi brjod la thos nas kyang mos pa thob par 'gyur na /
translated: does not turn back, does not speak ill of it, and upon hearing it attains faith,

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa /
translated: Ananda, you should know that this son or daughter of good family has served the victors of the past,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: has planted roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: and has been taken up by a spiritual friend.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lta'ang mi slu ste /🔽nyan thos sam /🔽rang sangs @424b rgyas sam /
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa lta'ang mi slu ste / nyan thos sam / rang sangs @424b rgyas sam /
translated: Nanda, if any son or daughter of noble family does not deceive the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, and plants the roots of virtue with them,🔽whether they become a śrāvaka,🔽a pratyekabuddha,

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: or a buddha,

original: 'on kyang dga' bo /
analyzed: 'on kyang dga' bo /
translated: Nanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of generosity, who practice the perfection of moral discipline, who practice the perfection of patience, who practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /🔽stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: to the perfection of meditative stability, to the perfection of wisdom, to inner emptiness, to outer emptiness, to outer and inner emptiness,🔽to the emptiness of emptiness, to great emptiness, to the emptiness of ultimate reality, to the emptiness of the conditioned, to the emptiness of the unconditioned,

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang // thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang // thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: to the emptiness of the unlimited, to the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, to the emptiness of non-dispersal, to the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽and to the emptiness of all things.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: They are the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of nonentities, the emptiness of essential nature,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang @425a *//
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang @425a *//
translated: the emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power,

original: pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa dang // 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa dang // 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the noble truths,

original: bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnams la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnams la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice the meditative stabilities, they practice the immeasurables, they practice the formless absorptions, they practice the aspects of liberation, they practice the serial absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are gateways to liberation, they practice the clairvoyances, they practice the meditative stabilities, they practice the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod pa dang / byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod pa dang / byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice the powers of the tathāgatas, they practice fearlessness, they practice the correct understandings, they practice great love, they practice great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: They should practice the distinct attributes of a buddha, and they should practice the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, and the state of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub la spyod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rnam pa @425b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pas shin tu rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rang byang chub la spyod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rnam pa @425b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pas shin tu rtogs par bya'o //
translated: They should practice a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, they should practice the knowledge of path aspects, and they should practice the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shin tu rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who have fully understood should practice the perfection of giving, should practice the perfection of morality, should practice the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /🔽phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: those who practice the perfection of perseverance, those who practice the perfection of concentration, those who practice the perfection of wisdom, those who practice inner emptiness, those who practice outer emptiness,🔽those who practice inner and outer emptiness, those who practice the emptiness of emptiness, those who practice great emptiness, those who practice ultimate emptiness, those who practice conditioned emptiness,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: those who practice unconditioned emptiness, those who practice the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, those who practice the emptiness of no beginning and no end, those who practice the emptiness of nonrepudiation,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: It is to practice the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of nonthings,

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings. It is to practice the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts,

original: @426a *// rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: @426a *// rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnams la spyod pa dang /🔽mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa rnams la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: to practice the noble truths, to practice the concentrations, to practice the immeasurables, to practice the formless absorptions, to practice the deliverances,🔽to practice the serial absorptions, to practice the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness that are the gateways to liberation, to practice the clairvoyances,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: to practice the meditative stabilities, to practice the dhāraṇī gateways, to practice the powers of the tathāgatas, to practice fearlessness, to practice the correct understandings,

original: byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: They are practicing the four immeasurables, practicing the four formless absorptions, practicing the five clairvoyances, practicing the six perfections, practicing the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, practicing the powers, fearlessnesses, and detailed and thorough knowledges, practicing the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways to liberation, practicing the ten tathāgata powers, practicing the four fearlessnesses, practicing the four detailed and thorough knowledges, practicing the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, practicing the knowledge of all aspects, practicing the knowledge of path aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa ni nyan thos sam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa ni nyan thos sam /
translated: and practicing the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not become śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.

original: dga' bo / de bas na @426b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad de /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na @426b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod la gtad de /
translated: “ Nanda, therefore, I entrust this deep perfection of wisdom to you.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis ngas chos gang ji snyed cig bshad pa las /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis ngas chos gang ji snyed cig bshad pa las /
translated: Nanda, if you were to take up all the dharmas I have explained

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma gtogs par ngas chos bstan pa de dag thams cad bzung ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma gtogs par ngas chos bstan pa de dag thams cad bzung ste /
translated: except for the perfection of wisdom,

original: kun chub par byas nas /
analyzed: kun chub par byas nas /
translated: master them,

original: de'i 'og tu chud gsan te bor yang de tsam gyis dga' bo khyod la skyon du ngas mi rtsi'i /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chud gsan te bor yang de tsam gyis dga' bo khyod la skyon du ngas mi rtsi'i /
translated: and then forget them, I would not consider that a fault of yours.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyi sa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyi sa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste /
translated: Nanda, if you, having received this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: kun chub par byas nas de'i 'og tu chud gsan tam /
analyzed: kun chub par byas nas de'i 'og tu chud gsan tam /
translated: having mastered it,

original: bor bar 'gyur na des ni /
analyzed: bor bar 'gyur na des ni /
translated: then forget it,

original: dga' bo khyod la ngas skyon du gzung ngo //
analyzed: dga' bo khyod la ngas skyon du gzung ngo //
translated: then, Nanda, I would hold it against you.

original: dga' bo / de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid khyod la gtad kyi /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid khyod la gtad kyi /
translated: Therefore, Nanda, I entrust to you this very profound perfection of wisdom.

original: ci nas kyang gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / shin tu yid la gzung bar gyis shig /
analyzed: ci nas kyang gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bklag pa dang / kun chub par bya ba dang / shin tu yid la gzung bar gyis shig /
translated: By all means, you should receive it, keep it, read it, master it, and keep it in mind.

original: legs par yongs su zin pa dang / legs par kun chub pa dang / legs par bcang bar gyis shig /
analyzed: legs par yongs su zin pa dang / legs par kun chub pa dang / legs par bcang bar gyis shig /
translated: You should receive it well, understand it well, and keep it well.

original: yi ge dang / tshig dang / 'bru shin tu rdzogs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig legs par shin tu zin par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge dang / tshig dang / 'bru shin tu rdzogs pa dang / nges pa'i tshig legs par shin tu zin par bya'o //
translated: You should receive the letters, words, and syllables well, and the well-received definitive words.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa des ni /🔽'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang @427a *//
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa des ni / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang @427a *//
translated: Ananda, any son or daughter of good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, and masters this profound perfection of wisdom

original: chub bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chub bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will have taken hold of the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present.

original: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa des ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub mthun par yongs su bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo / rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa des ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub mthun par yongs su bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Ananda, any son or daughter of good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, and masters this profound perfection of wisdom will have taken hold of the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present in a way that accords with reality.

original: dga' bo / mngon du gyur par nga la gang me tog dang / 'phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya ba dang /
analyzed: dga' bo / mngon du gyur par nga la gang me tog dang / 'phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya ba dang /
translated: “Ānanda, those who wish to honor me with flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, powders, clothing, parasols, victory banners, and flags, and to venerate, respect, and worship me in person, should take up this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: bkur stir bya ba dang / phu dud du bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pa des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung bar bya /🔽bcang bar bya /
analyzed: bkur stir bya ba dang / phu dud du bya ba dang / mchod par bya bar 'dod pa des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung bar bya / bcang bar bya /
translated: They should bear it in mind,

original: klag par bya /
analyzed: klag par bya /
translated: read it, and master it.

original: kun chub par bya'o; ;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste /
analyzed: kun chub par bya'o; ;shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bzung ste /
translated: Having taken up this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: bcangs nas bklags shing kun chub par bya ste /
analyzed: bcangs nas bklags shing kun chub par bya ste /
translated: having borne it in mind, read it, and mastered it,

original: me tog dang / 'phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang; na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya /🔽bkur stir bya /🔽phu dud du bya /
analyzed: me tog dang / 'phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang; na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyis rim gror bya / bkur stir bya / phu dud du bya /
translated: they should honor it with flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments, powders, clothing, parasols, victory banners, and flags,

original: mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o //
translated: and venerate, respect, and worship it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rim gro dang; bkur sti dang / phu dud dang / mchod pa byas na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rim gro dang; bkur sti dang / phu dud dang / mchod pa byas na /
translated: If you honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to the perfection of wisdom,

original: des ni nga'ang mchod par 'gyur /
analyzed: des ni nga'ang mchod par 'gyur /
translated: you will also be making offerings to me.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @427b rnams kyang mchod par 'gyur ro //🔽dga' bo / gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa la rim gro dang / dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed pa des ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das @427b rnams kyang mchod par 'gyur ro // dga' bo / gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa la rim gro dang / dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed pa des ni 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang /
translated: You will be making offerings to the past, future, and present Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / mos pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “ Nanda, whoever generates respect, joy, and interest in this teaching of the profound perfection of wisdom will generate respect, joy, and interest in the past, future, and present Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod la nga sdug cing yid du 'ong la yongs su ma btang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod la nga sdug cing yid du 'ong la yongs su ma btang zhe na /
translated: “ Nanda, if you find me attractive, pleasing, and not at all disagreeable,

analyzed: dga' bo / khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di sdug pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yongs su mi gtang bar gyis shig /

original: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las tshig 'ga' yang khyod kyis chud ma zos par gyis shig /🔽dga' bo / ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gtad pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di las tshig 'ga' yang khyod kyis chud ma zos par gyis shig / dga' bo / ngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di gtad pa las brtsams te /
translated: In every way, you should not let even a single word of this profound perfection of wisdom be lost.

original: khyod la shin tu mang du bstan pa'ang mdor na /
analyzed: khyod la shin tu mang du bstan pa'ang mdor na /
translated: Nanda, I have taught you a great deal, beginning with the entrustment of this profound perfection of wisdom.🔽In brief,

original: dga' bo / khyod la nga ji ltar ston par gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod kyi ston pa yin gyis /
analyzed: dga' bo / khyod la nga ji ltar ston par gyur ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di khyod kyi ston pa yin gyis /
translated: Nanda, just as I have been your teacher, so too this profound perfection of wisdom is your teacher.

original: dga' bo / de bas na ngas khyod la tshad med par gtad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su gtad de /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na ngas khyod la tshad med par gtad pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su gtad de /

analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na ngas lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mdun du brjod de /

translated: the future, and the present Buddha Bhagavats, and does not abandon the awakening of the past, future, and present Buddha Bhagavats, should not abandon this profound perfection of wisdom.

translated: It is the producer.

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa de dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob pa de dag thams cad ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Nanda, all those bodhisattva great beings who train in the six perfections will go forth to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dga' bo / de bas na khyod la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag yang dang yang du yongs su gtad do //
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas na khyod la pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag yang dang yang du yongs su gtad do //
translated: Nanda, therefore, I entrust these six perfections to you again and again.

original: rjes su gtad do //
analyzed: rjes su gtad do //
translated: I give them to you.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' bo / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod de /
analyzed: dga' bo / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi mdzod de /
translated: Nanda, this is the Dharma treasury of the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly complete buddhas.

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod ni zad mi shes pa'i chos kyi mdzod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod ni zad mi shes pa'i chos kyi mdzod do //
translated: Thus, the treasury of the six perfections is an inexhaustible Dharma treasury.

original: dga' bo / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na /
analyzed: dga' bo / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag na /
translated: Nanda, in the limitless, countless, and immeasurable world systems of the ten directions,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod 'di las chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mdzod 'di las chos ston to //
translated: the bhagavat buddhas, the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones, however many there are, who abide, live, and teach the dharma, those bhagavat buddhas teach the dharma from this treasury of the six perfections.

original: dga' bo / 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la bslabs nas /
analyzed: dga' bo / 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la bslabs nas /
translated: Nanda, the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones, however many there were in the past, they also, having trained in these six perfections,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te chos bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te chos bstan to //
translated: attained perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment and taught the dharma.

original: dga' bo / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @431a *//
analyzed: dga' bo / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @431a *//
translated: Nanda, the tathagatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones, however many there will be in the future, they also, having trained in these six perfections,

original: par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la bslabs te /
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la bslabs te /
translated: All those who have appeared as perfect buddhas have trained in these six perfections,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te /
translated: and have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: They have taught the Dharma.

original: dga' bo / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyad cig yod pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs te /
analyzed: dga' bo / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyan thos gang ji snyad cig yod pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs te /
translated: “Ānanda, all those śrāvaka-disciples of the past, future, and present lord buddhas have trained in this perfection of wisdom,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to //🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to // yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: and have attained complete nirvāṇa.🔽They will attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are attaining complete nirvāṇa.

original: dga' bo gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams la nyan thos kyi sa las brtsams te /
analyzed: dga' bo gal te khyod kyis gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams la nyan thos kyi sa las brtsams te /
translated: “Ānanda, if you teach the śrāvaka-vehicle persons the śrāvaka level,

original: chos bstan pa'i chos bstan pa des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur kyang /
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i chos bstan pa des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur kyang /
translated: Even if all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm were to actualize the state of an arhat through that Dharma teaching,

original: da rung nyan thos khyod kyis nga'i nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: da rung nyan thos khyod kyis nga'i nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: you, a śrāvaka, would still not have done what a śrāvaka needs to do.

original: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshig 'ga' zhig brjod de /🔽bstan kyang nyan thos khyod kyis nga dgyes par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i tshig 'ga' zhig brjod de / bstan kyang nyan thos khyod kyis nga dgyes par byas pa yin te /
translated: Nanda, if you were to say a few words to a bodhisattva great being that are in accord with the perfection of wisdom,🔽and teach it, you would please me,

original: nyan thos kyis nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis nyan thos kyi bya ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and you, a śrāvaka, would have done what a śrāvaka needs to do.

original: dga' bo / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dga' bo / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Nanda, what do you think?

original: chos bstan pa snga @431b ma des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur na /
analyzed: chos bstan pa snga @431b ma des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par dgra bcom pa nyid mngon du byed par gyur na /
translated: “Ananda, if all the sentient beings in a great trichiliocosm were to actualize arhatship,

original: dgra bcom pa de dag gi sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / sgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag mang ngam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa de dag gi sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi dngos po dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / sgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag mang ngam /
translated: would the merit of those arhats from giving, from morality, and from meditation be great?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: it would be great, Sugata.

original: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: It would be great, Blessed One.”

original: dga' bo / de bas gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la chung ngu na nyi ma gcig cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
analyzed: dga' bo / de bas gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la chung ngu na nyi ma gcig cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Nandika, therefore, if an individual of the Śrāvaka Vehicle were to teach the Dharma connected with the perfection of wisdom to a bodhisattva mahāsattva for even one day,

original: de'i bsod nams chos mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams chos mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: His merit would increase much more than that.

original: dga' bo / nyin gcig lta zhog gi /🔽dga' bo / gal te nyi ma phyed dam /
analyzed: dga' bo / nyin gcig lta zhog gi / dga' bo / gal te nyi ma phyed dam /
translated: Nanda, let alone one day,🔽Nanda, if for half a day,

original: dga' bo / nyi ma phyed lta zhog gi /🔽dga' bo gal te snga dro gcig gam /
analyzed: dga' bo / nyi ma phyed lta zhog gi / dga' bo gal te snga dro gcig gam /
translated: Nanda, let alone half a day,🔽Nanda, if for one morning,

original: dga' bo / snga dro gcig lta zhog gi /🔽dga' bo / gal te chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
analyzed: dga' bo / snga dro gcig lta zhog gi / dga' bo / gal te chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
translated: Nanda, let alone one morning,🔽Nanda, if for one hour,

original: dga' bo chu tshod gcig tsam lta zhog gi /
analyzed: dga' bo chu tshod gcig tsam lta zhog gi /
translated: Nanda, let alone one hour,

original: dga' bo / gal te skad 'ga' yud 'ga' thang 'ga' zhig gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan na /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te skad 'ga' yud 'ga' thang 'ga' zhig gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos bstan na /
translated: Nanda, if for a moment, for a second, for a short time, a person of the Śrāvaka Vehicle teaches the Dharma endowed with the perfection of wisdom to a bodhisattva great being,

original: dga' bo / de'i bsod nams ni chos mang du 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo / de'i bsod nams ni chos mang du 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Nanda, his merit would increase much more than that.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs @432a *//
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs @432a *//
translated: Śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang des zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang des zil gyis non par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the wholesome roots of those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the Universal Way will be outshone by that.

original: dga' bo / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la chung ngu na nyi ma gcig gam /
analyzed: dga' bo / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la chung ngu na nyi ma gcig gam /
translated: “Nanda, if a bodhisattva great being were to teach the doctrine associated with the perfection of wisdom to those who are followers of the Bodhisattva Vehicle, even for as little as a single day,

original: nyi ma phyed dam /
analyzed: nyi ma phyed dam /
translated: or half a day,

original: snga dro gcig gam /
analyzed: snga dro gcig gam /
translated: or a mere morning,

original: chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
analyzed: chu tshod gcig tsam mam /
translated: or an hour,

original: skad 'ga' yud 'ga' thang 'ga' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
analyzed: skad 'ga' yud 'ga' thang 'ga' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston na /
translated: or a few minutes, a few seconds, or a few moments,

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zil gyis non par gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zil gyis non par gyur te /
translated: Nanda, the wholesome roots of all those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage in the Listeners’ and solitary realizers’ vehicles would be outshone by that bodhisattva great being.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod la /🔽gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul zhing yang dag par dga' bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod la / gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul zhing yang dag par dga' bar byed pa yin /
translated: In this way, they themselves wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.🔽They encourage others to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood and delight in it.

original: yang dag par spro bar byed pa yin /🔽yang dag par gzhog pa yin /
analyzed: yang dag par spro bar byed pa yin / yang dag par gzhog pa yin /
translated: They inspire others to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.🔽They establish others in unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: yang dag par 'god pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'god pa yin te /
translated: They cause others to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi la spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi la spyod pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /
translated: Nandaka, bodhisattva great beings who practice like this, practicing the six perfections, practicing the four establishments of mindfulness, practicing the four right efforts, practicing the four legs of miraculous power,

original: dbang @432b po lnga la spyod pa dang / stobs lnga la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dbang @432b po lnga la spyod pa dang / stobs lnga la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, and the four noble truths.

original: bsam gtan bzhi la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, and the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are gateways to liberation, and they practice the superknowledges, the meditative stabilities, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la spyod pa dang / byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice the ten powers of the tathāgatas, they practice the four assurances, they practice the four kinds of exact knowledge, they practice the great love, they practice the great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la spyod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they practice the result of stream enterer, they practice the result of once-returner, they practice the result of non-returner, they practice the state of a worthy one,🔽they practice a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, they practice the knowledge of path aspects, and they practice the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rang byang chub la spyod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel ba ni /
analyzed: rang byang chub la spyod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par 'phel ba ni /
translated: They increase with many wholesome roots.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @433a *//
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub @433a *//
translated: They are irreversible from awakening.

original: las yongs su nyams pa'i gnas med /🔽skabs med do /
analyzed: las yongs su nyams pa'i gnas med / skabs med do /
translated: There is no basis for the complete degeneration of their karma.🔽There is no opportunity for it.

original: de ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: When this perfection of wisdom was being taught,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi dang / lha dang / mi dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lho 'phye chen po de ltar 'khod pa rnams kyi mdun du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor bzhi dang / lha dang / mi dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lho 'phye chen po de ltar 'khod pa rnams kyi mdun du /
translated: the Blessed One, in front of the fourfold retinue, the gods, humans, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas who were gathered there,

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang mngon par 'du mdzad pas thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa 'khor rgya mtsho lta bu 'khrug pa med pa kun kyang dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa gang mngon par 'du mdzad pas thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi 'khrugs pa 'khor rgya mtsho lta bu 'khrug pa med pa kun kyang dgra bcom pa /
translated: manifested a miracle through his supernormal knowledge, such that all of them saw the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya, with his ocean-like retinue, all of whom were arhats,

original: zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa /
translated: had exhausted the defilements,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa /
translated: were free from afflictions,

original: dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa /
translated: had attained mastery,

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: had completely liberated minds,

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /🔽cang shes pa /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /🔽cang shes pa /
translated: had completely liberated wisdom,🔽and were skilled in the knowledge of the right and wrong times.

original: glang po chen po /🔽bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: glang po chen po / bya ba byas pa /
